title: Petition to end microtrasactions in HK (link in post).

replies.msg:
http://chng.it/CLJJpJJsCw

If you have ever played the game SLAMDUNK, you definitely have experienced the frustration to unlock characters and upgrading them. That's because to unlock a character or upgrade them quicker requires you to pay for in-game currency and gamble them in the in-game casino to get better players or purchase virtual items to upgrade them.

According to Investopedia.com, “microtransaction is a business model where users can purchase virtual items for small amounts of money”. Games like League of Legends and Fortnite allow players to buy cosmetic items with real-world money but said cosmetic items do not affect gameplay. They will not affect players’ ability and chances of winning. However, microtransactions in games such as SLAMDUNK have a huge impact on gameplay. In SLAMDUNK, players could use real-world money to pay for in-game items to level the characters faster. The more you spend, the faster you can upgrade said characters. Players who also are willing to pay to get a new character a month before it releases in the regular market can pay for in-game items and “gamble” in the “casino”. Other games like the NBA 2K series and the FIFA series mostly make money from the same business model.

The gaming experience is completely ruined by microtransactions. If it had never existed, players could compete fairly and enjoy the game. Victory in a game will be based entirely on players’ skill and talent, instead of how much they make in real life.

But gaming does not have to be like this. Please end microtransactions for good. Thank you.
